title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
description: Authentic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper. Creamy without cream, this is the real Roman carbonara recipe!

instructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining.
While pasta cooks, cook pancetta in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy, about 8-10 minutes. Remove from heat.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, both cheeses, and black pepper until well combined.
Add drained hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta (off heat). Toss to coat with the rendered fat.

Quickly pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing continuously to create a creamy sauce. The residual heat will cook the eggs. Add reserved pasta water a little at a time if needed to reach desired consistency.
Serve immediately with extra grated cheese and black pepper on top. Buon appetito!

notes: Traditional carbonara doesn't use cream! The creaminess comes from the eggs and cheese.
Work quickly when combining the hot pasta with the egg mixture to create a smooth sauce without scrambling the eggs.
Use freshly grated cheese for the best flavor and texture.
The key is to remove the pan from heat before adding the egg mixture.

faqs.question: Why does my carbonara look scrambled?
faqs.answer: The pan might be too hot when you add the eggs. Always remove from heat and toss quickly. The residual heat will cook the eggs into a creamy sauce.

faqs.question: Can I use bacon instead of pancetta?
faqs.answer: Yes, but traditional carbonara uses guanciale or pancetta. Bacon will give a smokier flavor but works well as a substitute.

faqs.question: How do I reheat leftovers?
faqs.answer: Add a splash of pasta water or cream and reheat gently in a pan over low heat, tossing constantly to prevent the eggs from scrambling.
